title: Foundational Mathematics Competency Assessment Design for Engineering Students’ Calculus Preparation

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level algebra, trigonometry, and basic geometry concepts
context.additional_context: Systematic diagnostic assessment of foundational math competencies required before calculus for engineering freshmen, designed around tool development and validation in blended (online/offline) environments.

learning_goals: Acquiring the ability to develop assessment items in algebra, trigonometry, and geometry—essential areas for engineering students learning calculus.
Cultivating the ability to apply reliability and validity verification procedures for measurement tools (e.g., item difficulty analysis, discrimination evaluation).
Presenting criteria for constructing assessment items to evaluate geometric problem-solving skills (straight lines, circles, surface area/volume calculations).

Learners can analyze mid-term assessment results (exams, quizzes, assignment scores) to identify individual areas of weakness and create a learning plan including three or more personalized strategies (e.g., supplementary materials, adjusted study time, tutoring requests) to address them.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
